text:
Hi. I would like to include some vegalite.jl graphs in a markdown (via weave.jl) with the same interactive features as they have in the vscode julia extension (mainly the mouse over infos). I already tried to export the whole graph into a html (using  `VegaLite.writehtml_full`) or svg (`|> save("test2.svg")`)file. For the svg I get warnings while creating (e.g. `WARN Missing type for channel "x", using "quantitative" instead.`
`WARN Missing type for channel "tooltip", using "nominal" instead.`) and the file is empty in the end. For the html I get a working file however that shows the same error messages as the SVG in the browser console and the graph is broken (see attached screenshots).
Is there another way to do get the graphs into markdown with interactive features? Did I overlook something?
The code for the graph looks like this `df |> @vlplot(:boxplot, x = :x, y = :y, width=600, height=600)`
df has 2 columns, y is of Float64 and x is a CategoricalArray of Strings
